The R100 produces images with impressive clarity and dynamic range, and it has a native sensitivity range of ISO 100-12800, making it suitable for working in low-light conditions. The sensor and image processor also enable quick performance across the camera system, including the ability to shoot at up to 6.5 fps.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF Systems

The Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology of Canon EOS R100 has 3975 focusing points that cover 143 autofocus zones, providing enhanced precision throughout the whole picture plane. It also enables automated subject identification and Eye identification AF. Designed for speed and precision, our Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology allows you to attain critical focus with every photo.

Physically, the EOS R100 camera has a USB-C connector, a micro-HDMI port, and a 3.5mm microphone port for better video recording. In terms of wireless, Bluetooth connection allows you to connect the camera to compatible smart devices using the free Canon Camera Connect app.

The Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens of Canon EOS R100 promises to provide a wide zoom range in a small design. Canon EOS RP Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Canon EOS RP camera offers full-frame photography in a lightweight, user-friendly mirrorless camera. The robust DIGIC 8 Image Processor and the 26.2 Megapixel CMOS sensor make it simple to quickly and accurately capture amazingly detailed photographs, even in dim lighting. Any of the specialized RF lenses, or any EF or EF-S lens with an optional mount adapter, are required for the EOS RP camera to perform to its full potential. This tiny camera is made for visual storytellers who are ready to shoot in full frame.

26.2MP Full-Frame CMOS Sensor and DIGIC 8 Image Processor

Canon EOS RP has a sizable 26.2MP full-frame CMOS sensor, which strikes the perfect combination of high-resolution output, low-light capability, and fast processing speed. The EOS RP offers a broad native sensitivity range from ISO 100–40000 for working in a variety of lighting scenarios when paired with the DIGIC 8 image processor. For use with moving subjects, continuous shooting at a rate of up to 5 fps is also an option.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF

Dual Pixel CMOS AF provides quick and smooth focusing performance. In order to offer a large and dense network of phase-detection collection components throughout the bulk of the image sensor and eliminate focus hunting for faster, more direct control of focus placement, this device includes two distinct photodiodes within each pixel. This focusing mechanism works to swiftly and precisely gain focus when working with still imagery, making it the perfect choice for shooting and tracking moving subjects so that crucial focus is reached with each frame.

3.0-inch Vari-Angle Touch Screen LCD

The 3.0-inch Clear View LCD II vari-angle touch screen on the Canon EOS RP camera has a resolution of 1.04 Megapixels. Bright and crisp, it can be readily adjusted to shoot from a variety of angles, makes taking selfies simple, and it folds away when not in use.

Built-in OLED Electronic Viewfinder

The EOS RP mirrorless camera boasts a high-precision 0.39-inch built-in OLED Electronic Viewfinder with roughly 2.36 million dots and a 22mm eye point. It's remarkably pleasant for composing and evaluating photographs, even while wearing eyeglasses, as it offers a clear, bright, and vivid 100% view in addition to crucial shooting information.

Compatibility with EF/EF-S Lenses

An optional EF-EOS R mount adapter allows the EOS R and RP to use EF and EF-S lenses in addition to RF lenses, providing an almost endless array of creative possibilities. You can add depth to pictures and videos with the EOS R Series cameras thanks to the wide selection of EF and EF-S lenses.

Canon EOS R8 Mirrorless Camera(Only Body)

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The innovative Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R8 delivers incredibly quick and precise focusing performance, with 1053 automated AF points covering the whole sensor surface. This phase-detection focusing technology improves subject identification and tracking by intelligently recognizing people, animals, and cars, immediately latching onto these targets, and keeping tight focus throughout burst and video recordings. Furthermore, the low-luminance limit of this autofocus technology focuses down to a remarkable -6.5 EV for precise focusing in low-light circumstances.

HDR PQ and Canon Log 3

Though the EOS R8 camera can capture amazing video right out of the box, content producers wishing to take the next step in their imaging journey may choose between two powerful video recording options: HDR PQ or Canon Log 3 video recording. HDR PQ recording produces a 10-bit color file that does not require any modification. This 10-bit HDR file is compatible with HDR displays such as TVs, monitors, and smartphones, which provide more color accuracy and dynamic range than regular displays. Canon Log 3 is also accessible for artists who want to modify their video files, providing a 10-bit log file that enables for dramatic highlight and shadow recovery as well as creative color grading.

Livestreaming

The EOS R8 UVC/UAC compatibility allows it to be used as a web camera to stream live video in Full HD to applications such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Skype, and similar video conferencing software. The full-frame image sensor allows for exposure versatility as well as strong background separation when using bright aperture lenses for video conferencing or livestreaming content.

Movie Digital IS

With Movie Digital IS 5-axis image stabilization of EOS R8, you may record steady films with minimal equipment, even while filming handheld. When utilizing an RF lens with optical image stabilization, coordinated management of Movie Digital IS reduces camera-shake vibrations even more.

Flexible Connectivity

Wired and wireless communication options enable different means of sharing photographs and movies, as well as livestreaming and remotely operating the camera. The camera has a remote port, a USB-C connector, a micro-HDMI port, a microphone input, and a headphone jack for sound monitoring. The camera's built-in Bluetooth connection allows you to effortlessly link it to compatible smart devices using the free Canon Camera link app. This low-energy wireless connection conserves battery life while allowing remote camera operation. It also delivers continually updated GPS position data from your phone, allowing you to geotag your photos so you know exactly where you took them.

Tough, Durable Construction

Dual CFexpress Type B memory card slots provide flexible file storing while also promoting high-speed reading and writing to keep up with the quick continuous shooting and high-resolution 8K video recording. Both slots are also XQD memory card compatible.The Z9 is designed for professional use, with an ergonomic form factor and a vertical grip for simple transitioning between horizontal and vertical shooting configurations.

Versatile Connectivity

Matching the professional build quality of EOS R8, the Z9 is fitted with a variety of connectivity options. Full-size HDMI port for video output to an external recorder or monitor. USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C port for tethering, data transmission, and in-camera battery charging. The Ethernet connector provides a 1000BASE-T wired LAN connection for FTP file transfers. The 10-pin port supports a wide range of accessories and remote connectivity. PC sync port for flash synchronization. Bluetooth and Wi-Fi (2.4 and 5 GHz) allow for wireless file transfer, remote camera control via a mobile device, and operate in conjunction with the NX Mobile Air software for file management. GNSS allows for in-camera geotagging and storage of location information while shooting.

full_description:
Canon EOS R DSLR Camera Body

For all their appealing features one of the concerns of using a full-frame camera has been its larger profile, however, the EOS RP is the lightest and smallest Canon EOS full-frame camera to date. * Weighing approx. 440g (body only) while being impressively compact and comfortable to use, the EOS RP is more convenient to carry, shoot with, and store than any previous EOS full-frame camera before. Engineered to work seamlessly with RF lenses, the EOS RP also maintains complete compatibility with EF and EF-S lenses by using one of three optional Mount Adapters. When using EF-S lenses, the EOS RP even crops automatically to reflect the APS-C sized sensor the lenses are designed for. The EOS RP camera features a Canon-developed and produced 35mm full-frame CMOS sensor with approx. 26.2 effective megapixels. It employs the DIGIC 8 Image Processor to enhance the speed of operations across the board. This means fast, efficient performance and phenomenal image quality for big prints. The EOS RP camera's highly responsive Dual Pixel CMOS AF system features 4,779 manually selectable AF points** and can deliver sharp focus within approximately 0.05 seconds***. This means fast action can be captured and focus can be maintained with speed, accuracy and ease. Amazing for nighttime photography or in very low light, the EOS RP camera's brilliant AF can operate in light as dim as a light rating of EV -5^ where other AF systems may fail or search. Phenomenal AF is achieved even when using lenses with high F numbers. This ultra-sensitive AF works in concert with the EOS RP's EVF to clearly capture subjects even when there's limited light. Among the EOS RP camera's manual focus aids, Focus Peaking helps establish the focus area quickly and clearly. With manual focus peaking, the outline of the area in focus is indicated by a colored line. Focus Peaking is usable in conjunction with the EOS RP's Focus Guide feature, and can be customized with peaking color and detection level specifications that fit the project at hand. The EOS RP camera features a high-precision 0.39-inch OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) EVF with approx. 2.36 million dots and a 22mm eyepoint. The electronic viewfinder (EVF) has been created to provide a bright, sharp and colorful 100% view of the subject at hand. Equipped with an aspherical lens, the EVF shows a crisp and vivid image with minimal distortion, even when the eye moves off the center of the visual field. The EOS RP EVF has a bright, 22mm-high eyepoint design that creates a generous 30mm space between your nose and the rear of the viewfinder. This makes it easy to compose and view images in the viewfinder with or without glasses. The EVF's 0.39-inch OLED based display features approximately 2.36 million dots for an incredibly sharp and detailed image that makes it easy to check focus and view the extensive image data that's displayed. 32.5MP APS-C CMOS Sensor and DIGIC X Processing

The 32.5MP APS-C CMOS sensor is a versatile chip ideal for both photo and video applications because it successfully balances resolution, speed, and low-light performance. The R7 is one of the first APS-C sensors in the EOS R series, and its high-resolution design benefits both photographers and 4K video by offering a 7K area for oversampling footage, which results in better sharpness and quality. The Canon EOS R7 has a DIGIC X image processor that it borrowed from the R3 to execute a number of high-speed activities, including rapid continuous shooting and high-resolution video recording. Autofocus and Image Stabilization

A touchscreen interface and the crisp 1.62m-dot resolution enable vivid playback and live view monitoring, complementing the flexible position.

Dual Storage Card Slots and Wireless Connectivity

Next-Generation Multi-Function Shoe

The Canon EOS R7 Mirrorless Digital Camera features a multi-function shoe is an improvement over a traditional hot shoe that adds a row of pins to the front of the design to allow for broader accessory functionality and to supply power to some accessory types that often rely on separate batteries. For compatibility with older shoe-mounted attachments, this revised shoe is also compatible with the AD-E1 Multi-Function Shoe Adapter, the ST-E10 Speedlite Transmitter, the DM-E1D Stereo Microphone, and the AD-P1 Smartphone Link Adapter.

This combo delivers exceptional stills performance, stunning 4K 60p 10-bit video, and rapid focusing.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The innovative Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R8 delivers incredibly quick and precise focusing performance, with 1053 automated AF points covering the whole sensor surface. This phase-detection focusing technology improves subject identification and tracking by intelligently recognizing people, animals, and cars, immediately latching onto these targets, and keeping tight focus throughout burst and video recordings. Furthermore, the low-luminance limit of this autofocus technology focuses down to a remarkable -6.5 EV for precise focusing in low-light circumstances.

Movie Digital IS

With Movie Digital IS 5-axis image stabilization of EOS R8, you may record steady films with minimal equipment, even while filming handheld. When utilizing an RF lens with optical image stabilization, coordinated management of Movie Digital IS reduces camera-shake vibrations even more.

HDR PQ and Canon Log 3

Though the EOS R8 camera can shoot stunning video straight out of the box, content creators who want to take the next step in their imaging journey can select between two powerful video recording options: HDR PQ video recording or Canon Log 3 video recording. HDR PQ recording generates a 10-bit color file that does not need to be altered. This 10-bit HDR file is compatible with HDR displays, which give more color accuracy and dynamic range than standard displays. Canon Log 3 is also available for artists who want to make changes to their video files, including a 10-bit log file that allows for dramatic highlight and shadow recovery as well as creative color grading.

Livestreaming

The EOS R8 UVC/UAC compatibility allows it to be used as a web camera to stream live video in Full HD to applications such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Skype, and similar video conferencing software. The full-frame image sensor allows for exposure versatility as well as strong background separation when using bright aperture lenses for video conferencing or livestreaming content.

Flexible Connectivity

It also continuously updates your phone's GPS position data, allowing you to geotag your images so you know exactly where you took them.

Tough, Durable Construction

Dual CFexpress Type B memory card slots provide flexible file storing while also promoting high-speed reading and writing to keep up with the quick continuous shooting and high-resolution 8K video recording. The EOS R8 camera with lens is designed for professional use, with an ergonomic form factor and a vertical grip for simple transitioning between horizontal and vertical shooting configurations.

Versatile Connectivity

USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C port for tethering, data transmission, and in-camera battery charging. The Ethernet connector provides a 1000BASE-T wired LAN connection for FTP file transfers. The 10-pin port supports a wide range of accessories and remote connectivity. PC sync port for flash synchronization. Bluetooth and Wi-Fi (2.4 and 5 GHz) allow for wireless file transfer, remote camera control via a mobile device, and operate in conjunction with the NX Mobile Air software for file management. The STM stepping motor provides fast, quiet, smooth, and precise autofocus performance that is suited for both video and still photography. Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera features Dual Pixel CMOS AF II, In-body Image Stabilization, 4K video capability, People and Animal Detection, and more. It has been designed to satisfy the needs of both photographers and makers of video content who need a robust and adaptable camera to keep up with their active lives. Thanks to its high-performance CMOS sensor and DIGIC X image processor, it can effortlessly switch between shooting fast-paced action sports and 4K cinematic footage.

20MP Full-Frame Sensor and DIGIC X Processor

The EOS R6 delivers moderate resolution to match a more manageable workflow, especially for individuals working with the web and tiny print forms as their final output. It is built around a redesigned 20MP full-frame CMOS sensor. Together with the optimized DIGIC X image processor, this sensor offers outstanding still and video capabilities as well as sensitivity ranging from ISO 100-102400 and expandable to ISO 204800.

4K60 and Full HD 120 Video Recording

The 20MP sensor offers UHD 4K video recording at up to 60 frames per second in addition to Full HD at 120 frames per second for slow-motion playback. Both Canon Log and HDR-PQ are available for internal recording in both formats at 4:2:2 10-bit for high dynamic range output and more control over color rendering. Additionally, external recording through the HDMI connection offers clear 4K output to an optional external recording, and Dual Pixel CMOS AF is enabled for all recording settings.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The Canon EOS R6 camera offers a highly responsive Dual Pixel CMOS AF II system. The 1053 selectable focusing points of the upgraded Dual Pixel CMOS AF II provide wide and even coverage, covering almost 100% of the image frame. Similar to how a camcorder gains focus, this focusing technology offers quick and smooth performance. In order to eliminate focus hunting and offer a wide and dense network of phase-detection collection elements throughout most of the image sensor, this technology includes two independent photodiodes within each pixel. This allows for quicker, more precise control of focus placement.

Sensor-Shift Image Stabilizer

The R6 has five-axis sensor-shift image stabilization, a first for EOS cameras, that can effectively adjust for up to an amazing eight stops of camera shake to accommodate handheld shooting with slower shutter speeds. Additionally, for both native RF lenses and adapted EF lenses, this stabilization technology functions in conjunction with lens-based optical image stabilization.

0.5-type OLED EVF with Approx. 3.69 Million Dots

The Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera has a high-precision 0.5-inch OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) EVF with about 3.69 million dots and a 23mm eyepoint. A bright, clear, and colorful 100% view of the subject is offered by the EOS R6's EVF, which supports a 120 fps refresh rate. when switching from a landscape to a portrait arrangement, displaying a clear image and a wealth of shooting data that rotates with the camera's angle.

Dual Storage Card Slots and Wireless Connectivity

The EOS R6 camera has two card slots for UHS-II SD memory cards, making use of its small design. Both slots support internal recording of 4K 60p movies as well as burst shooting of approximately 20MP still images at rates of up to 20 fps. Both 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are available for quick file transfers to mobile devices via the Canon Camera Connect app. Bluetooth also enables persistent device connection.

Dust- & Water-resistant Sealing

The Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera is made to work in a range of weather conditions. Critical locations including the buttons, terminal covers, battery compartment, and card slot lid are sealed with sealing materials. The rest of the camera body's exposure to inadvertent dust and moisture is reduced thanks to precise design and manufacture.

Shutter Durability

Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera has a full-frame focal-plane shutter that enables around 12 shots per second and a durability rating of about 300,000 cycles.

Updated Full-Frame Sensor

The EOS R6 Mark II contains a new 24.2MP CMOS sensor that's adaptable for both picture and video applications, works well in low-light circumstances, and produces beautiful and true colors.

DIGIC X Processor

The EOS R6 Mark II enhanced processing, borrowed from the R3, complements the camera's multimedia capabilities. The DIGIC X enables up to 40 frames per second continuous shooting with a quiet electronic shutter or 12 frames per second with a mechanical shutter, including AF and AE readings before each shot. There's also a 30 fps RAW Burst mode with pre-release capture to catch moments up to 0.5 seconds before you hit the shutter.

UHD 4K Video Recording

Aside from stills, the EOS R6 Mark II sensor supports high-resolution UHD 4K 60p internal video using the whole width of the sensor, as well as 10-bit sampling with Canon Log 3. A 6K recording area may also be utilized for oversampled 4K 30p shooting for increased clarity, moiré reduction, and noise reduction. In addition, 180p recording at up to Full HD quality is enabled for slow-motion playback.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The Advanced Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R6 Mark II has 1053 automated AF points that span the whole sensor area and deliver very fast, responsive, and precise focusing performance. This phase-detection focusing system also features improved subject identification and tracking, thanks to deep learning technology, and can distinguish humans, animals, and cars intelligently. Subject tracking will automatically latch onto these subjects and keep them in great focus when shooting, even during burst snaps and video recording.

Sensor-Shift Image Stabilizer

This 5-axis system may also be used in conjunction with optical image stabilization lenses to compensate for up to 8 stops of camera shaking, depending on the lens in use. Reliable and Intuitive Handling

This camera has a dust- and moisture-sealed housing structure that makes it suited for operating in harsh weather. Flexible Connectivity

USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 connector for in-camera charging and file transfers; this port also allows the EOS R6 Mark II camera to be used as a Full HD 30p webcam with UVC/UAC protocol capability. Canon EOS R5 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Only Body)

The Canon EOS R5 full-frame mirrorless camera is designed for professional image makers who require resolution, speed, and video capabilities. It features a newly developed 45MP CMOS sensor, 8K raw video recording, 12 fps continuous shooting with a mechanical shutter, and is the first EOS camera to feature 5-axis sensor-shift image stabilization. In addition to the image assets, the R5, despite its redesigned design, feels familiar to EOS 5-series customers. A very high-resolution 0.5" 5.76m-dot electronic viewfinder provides a realistic 120 fps refresh rate, while the 3.2" rear touchscreen LCD panel has a vari-angle design to satisfy vlogging demands and benefit working from high and low angles. A top status LCD allows for an easy workflow, and the camera includes two memory card slots—one CFexpress Type B and one SD UHS-II—as well as Bluetooth and Wi-Fi wireless connection.

IBIS High Resolution 400MP Files

The IBIS High Resolution shot option on the EOS R5 with firmware 1.8.1 or later may produce 400 megapixel (approx.) files in-camera without the need for additional software. This capability is useful in instances when a high-resolution file with fine detail is required. Art replication and architectural signs are two examples.

45MP Full-Frame Sensor and DIGIC X Processor

The EOS R5 is built on a newly designed 45MP full-frame CMOS sensor and delivers both high-resolution stills and video output, with the fine-tuned DIGIC X image processor providing a wealth of speed. The ISO 100-51200 sensitivity range, which can be raised to ISO 102400, is perfect for working in a variety of lighting circumstances, while rapid continuous shooting at up to 12 frames per second with a mechanical shutter or quiet 20 frames per second with an electronic shutter is great for dealing with moving subjects.

8K30 Raw and 4K120 Video Recording

The 45MP full-frame sensor of EOS R5 allows for astonishingly high-resolution DCI 8K 30 fps raw video recording internally, as well as 4K recording up to 120 fps in 4:2:2 10-bit with Canon Log. HDR-PQ recording is also supported, as well as in-camera HDR creation and external recording via the HDMI connector, which provides a crisp 4K output at up to 60 frames per second. There are choices for both All-I and IPB compression, as well as Dual Pixel CMOS AF when shooting at up to 8K raw.

HDMI 8K Raw Output to Atomos Ninja V+

Firmware update 1.4.0 adds the ability to output 8K30, 10-bit footage to the Atomos Ninja V+ recorder via an optional HDMI connection for ProRes raw recording. (Please keep in mind that the recorder may grow heated.)

Body Design and Wireless Connectivity

The EOS R5 has five-axis sensor-shift image stabilization, a first for EOS cameras, that adjusts for up to an amazing eight stops of camera motion for genuinely effective compensation of camera shake for handheld photography with slower shutter speeds. This stabilization technology is also compatible with lens-based optical image stabilization for both original RF and modified EF lenses.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The upgraded Dual Pixel CMOS AF II has 1053 customizable focusing points that cover around 100% of the picture frame for wide and even coverage. This focusing technology of EOS R5 provides smooth and rapid focusing performance in the same way as a camcorder does. A Movie Servo AF option for recording video provides smooth and natural focusing when switching between objects or distances inside the picture, as well as the flexibility to select tracking sensitivity, AF speed, and Face Tracking priority. Rack focus is achieved with the Touch AF technology simply by touching parts within the scene on the touchscreen to adjust focus in an easy manner. The high-resolution 5.67m-dot 0.5"

Body Design and Wireless Connectivity

The high-resolution 5.67m-dot 0.5" electronic viewfinder is bright and crisp for eye-level viewing, and the rapid 120 fps refresh rate enables natural motion depiction for a more realistic viewfinder experience. The rear 3.2" 2.1m-dot LCD touchscreen has a vari-angle design that advantages both front-facing filming, such as for vlogging, and working from high and low shooting angles. To rapidly examine camera and shooting settings, utilize the top status LCD. For versatile storage, CFexpress Type B and SD UHS-II memory card ports are included; the CFexpress slot is perfect for 8K video and high-speed, high-resolution burst shooting, while the SD card slot preserves a familiar form factor for wide compatibility.

full_description:
Canon EOS R10 Mirrorless Camera With 18-45mm Lens

The Canon EOS R10 is a compact mirrorless camera with a hybrid ethos that emphasizes mobility without compromising capabilities. The R10 introduces an APS-C sensor to the R system, as well as high-speed shooting, clever AF, and excellent 4K video recording to support a multimedia workflow.

APS-C Comes to EOS R

The Canon EOS R10 has a 24.2MP APS-C CMOS sensor, which lies in a resolution sweet spot and provides an excellent balance of resolution, file size, speed, and low-light performance. This sensor is suitable for both regular photography and UHD 4K recording since the file sizes are tiny enough to allow both fast continuous burst shooting and long video recording.

DIGIC X Processor

The Canon EOS R10 uses a DIGIC X image processor from the R3 to perform a number of high-speed operations including as continuous shooting and high-resolution video recording. The R10 can shoot at up to 23 frames per second with a silent electronic shutter or 15 frames per second with a mechanical shutter, providing AF and AE readings before each shot. The CPU also adds to a wide ISO 100-32000 sensitivity range, which is expandable up to ISO 51200 for working in low-light conditions.

UHD 4K Video Recording

Aside from still photography, the Canon EOS R10 features high-resolution UHD 4K 8-bit recording at up to 60p using a reduced section of the sensor or at 30p using an oversampled 6K recording area for better clarity, moiré reduction, and noise reduction. Furthermore, 120p recording at up to Full HD resolution is supported for slow-motion playback.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The advanced Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology, which was carried over from the EOS R3, features 651 automatic AF points that cover the whole sensor area for faster, more responsive, and more precise focusing performance. This phase-detection focusing technology also offers better subject recognition and tracking capabilities, with the ability to intelligently discern between humans, animals, and vehicles, and tracking will automatically latch onto these objects and maintain tight focus during burst photos.

Intuitive Construction

A bright, sharp 2.36m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder is incorporated with the EOS R10 for high-resolution eye-level viewing. This 0.95x finder has fast processing with almost no latency, and a fast 120-fps refresh rate may be configured for vivid, realistic motion portrayal. There is also a 3.0" vari-angle LCD that lets you to operate at high, low, and front-facing angles. The adjustable posture is complemented with a touchscreen interface, and the superb 1.04m-dot resolution allows for vivid playback and live view monitoring.

Flexible Connectivity

There are both wired and wireless networking options, allowing for different means of transmitting photographs and movies as well as remotely managing the camera. Physically, the EOS R10 camera has a USB Type-C port, a micro-HDMI port, and a 3.5mm microphone port for video recording. Wireless options include 2.4GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth for data transfer and remote camera control.

Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens

The Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens of Canon EOS R10 promises a broad zoom range in a small design. It is designed exclusively for Canon's APS-C-format R Series mirrorless cameras and has a 29-72mm equivalent zoom range. Furthermore, the retractable shape makes it excellent for everyday use when you wish to fit the camera into a bag.
